Posts.Content: Sep 21, 2010 10:14AM lovesnature wrote: I had read on this site about pain and the tracer shots. I spoke with my surgeon about my fears. It was his opinion that the lidocaine was painful as well, so he doesn't really order them. What he did do (bless his heart) was order an injection of dilauded. I was already hooked to IV for surgery do I didn't even feel that. I ony have the briefest of memories of the tracer shots. Oh it did require an RN being with me, I'm sure some hospitals are reluctant to do it. The anesthgeolist (sp) can dea with the dilauded when he does the general in surgery.

Posts.Content: Oct 5, 2010 05:40PM lovesnature wrote: I had BMX with T/E, and SNB with three nodes taken. I was in the hospitol two nights. On the third night at around 10PM my DR popped in and said I could go home if I wanted. It was up to me. I choose to go home. I had no complications, good pain management, good support at home. I cannot imagine going home sooner than I did.
